stories.text:
I know this could be accomplished using a license, however impossing additional restrictions raises issues with compatibility, hesitancy to use the software and finally makes the resulting license not free or not opensource.

Do you have any ideas (or examples of something like this being done) how to discourage the use of code i own for military, collonialist, statist, ... purposes?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to discourage use of code by totalitarians, militarists or fascists?

stories.text: How much research is good enough? What goes in to your research?
stories.title: Ask HN: How much research you do before any important meeting
Millions under strict lockdown in China after Covid outbreak

stories.text: I'm going to apply as a Backend Developer in a tech company around next month. I majored in health, did not finish. I'm not gonna tell anything about my education either because they don't require any bachelor certificate. They have system design interview, some coding interview and some behavioral interview. Now I'm learning system design, CP, and also building a project with golang. What should I do to increase my chance of being accepted? Thank you
stories.title: Ask HN: Advice for Applying as Back End Dev
